intro: Psychotria nervosa, commonly known as the "Crimson Psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its striking red flowers and elliptical, dark green leaves with prominent veins. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Psychotria nervosa is also noted for its use in traditional medicine and as a source of alkaloids.
